 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְגֶּ֫רֶת‎</span> 

**noun feminine 1.** ==border, rim==. 

**2.** fastness; — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Exod.25.27|Exod 25:27]]; [[Exod.37.14|Exod 37:14]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Exod.25.25|Exod 25:25]]; [[Exod.37.12|Exod 37:12]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְגַּרְתּוֺ‎</span> [[Exod.25.25|Exod 25:25]]; [[Exod.37.12|Exod 37:12]] plural absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְגְּרוֺת‎</span> [[1Kgs.7.28|1Kgs 7:28]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְגְּרֹתֶיהָ‎</span> v[[1Kgs.7.35|1Kgs 7:35]] v[[1Kgs.7.36|1Kgs 7:36]], etc.; — 

**1.** ***border, rim*** (enclosure), of sacred table in tabernacle [[Exod.25.25|Exod 25:25]] (twice in verse); [[Exod.25.27|Exod 25:27]] = [[Exod.37.12|Exod 37:12]] (twice in verse); [[Exod.37.14|Exod 37:14]] of bases of the sea, in temple [[1Kgs.7.28|1Kgs 7:28]] (twice in verse); [[1Kgs.7.29|1Kgs 7:29]]; [[1Kgs.7.31|1Kgs 7:31]]; [[1Kgs.7.32|1Kgs 7:32]]; [[1Kgs.7.35|1Kgs 7:35]]; [[1Kgs.7.36|1Kgs 7:36]] (compare [[BDB#Benz|Benz]]), also [[2Kgs.16.17|2Kgs 16:17]]. 

**2.** ***fastness***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיַחְרְגוּ מִמּ‎</span> [[Ps.18.46|Ps 18:46]] = [[2Sam.22.46|2Sam 22:46]] (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חרג‎</span>) ***and they shall come quaking out of their fastnesses***, so [[Mic.7.17|Mic 7:17]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִרְגְּזוּ‎</span>, like reptiles), all of nations, in awe of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>. 

II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סגר‎</span> (√ of following; compare apparently Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***fill with water*** [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1308</sup>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> torrent ***that fills everything*** Id<sup>ib</sup>.; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***imber vehemens***, and Samaritan <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַסְגָּר‎</span>, compare [[BDB#Gei|Gei]]<sup>Nachgel. Schr. iv. 186</sup>).
